content: @WG-prioritization we will be starting our meeting in ~ 13 mins
maybe check out what's pending in https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization/issues
and think of ideas to keep improving our process :)
@WG-prioritization :wave:, please add a :wave: to know who is participating
(will be afk for the first 10-15 mins)
this is expected to last 30 minutes or less
I believe :)
ok, so I guess we can start checking the issues and seeing how we can move some of them forward?
does that sounds good?
or if someone has something specific to discuss it's also ok
thoughts?
I guess I can start checking the issues ... :)
rust-lang issues of priorit. issues?
ohh, sorry
right, prioritization ones

Santiago Pastorino said:

maybe check out what's pending in https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization/issues

:point_up:
first one Add to-announce to FCPs once they are finished #9

ok, then I'd just leave a note that I'd like to try handling one or both ( if that makes sense) these issues
https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization/issues/9
https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization/issues/2
that issue is ready to implement

apiraino said:

ok, then I'd just leave a note that I'd like to try handling one or both ( if that makes sense) these issues
https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization/issues/9
https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization/issues/2

good to me for sure :)
those are both ready to be implemented

good to me for sure :)

you know I will have questions :slight_smile:
it's fine, it's not that I really know the code but I guess we can figure it out
@LeSeulArtichaut is the master of triagebot :P
or well we can also ask simulacrum in case we need help
do you want me to assign you to those @apiraino ?
or just pick the one you want to start working on
and once you finish we assign you the other one?
By the way I won’t be able to attend this meeting. Sorry! If you have anything for me please ping me :slight_smile:
ok I will pick them myself (first gonna check them)

LeSeulArtichaut said:

By the way I won’t be able to attend this meeting. Sorry! If you have anything for me please ping me :)

maybe just a little question ... where you working on https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization/issues/1 ?

apiraino said:

ok I will pick them myself (first gonna check them)

I'd suggest you to tackle this one https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization/issues/9, because it's a bit more important
ok
other than that, the main missing thing is https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization/issues/8
which is also not clearly defined
but I guess we can even discuss this more in a high level way
that issue is more or less about improving our procedure a bit more
maybe the more general question is ... how do people feel we could improve our process a bit more?
I'm asking this because maybe https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization/issues/8 is not the answer to it
I'm not really sure
I'm not sure if I even need those or all of those things
so ... maybe we can take a step back for a bit and refresh what we usually do and what we can improve
in general we are working async and we're being requested by bots to do some work in an async way
that's completely fine and right now I can't think of a way to improve that
what we do there is put things in place so we can then place the right items into the agenda
and that happens the day before the meeting
I think at that time is when things could be improved a bit more (or not :slight_smile: )
what I do the day before is follow this procedure https://forge.rust-lang.org/compiler/prioritization/procedure.html
basically this ...

Follow ups from previous meeting
        Remove I-nominated tags of already discussed issues
        Notify @pnkfelix about not properly tagged stable/beta-nominated issues
        Create the next meeting agenda using the weekly agenda template
    Prepare agenda content
        Add T-compiler and libs-impl to unlabelled T-compiler and libs-impl issues
        Assign priority to unprioritized issues with "I-prioritize" label
        Assign priority to regressions without a P-* label
        Process MCPs/FCPs
    Generate Agenda
        Run cli to generate agenda
        Fill agenda announcements
        Add performance logs
        Summarize stable/beta nominations
        Summarize PR's waiting on team
        Summarize P-critical and unassigned P-high regressions
        Summarize I-nominated issues
    Notify the team about the meeting
        Figure out which WGs need to check-in
        Notify @T-compiler/meeting about the meeting on Zulip
    Final reviews
        Check toolstate
        Check performance stats
        Nominate issues
        Re-sync and check the agenda right before the meeting
is a good summary of everything we do
starting on Generate Agenda is what happens the day before the meeting until some minutes before the meeting
as I've said, I'm mainly following the procedure and I'm not sure if bots would be any better than visiting this procedure and clicking links and acting
I'm starting to think that there's no way to automate this in a better way than this document
for sure the cli to generate the agenda is useful
if someone have thoughts ... more than welcome
otherwise I guess I'm going to keep an eye tomorrow to see how I can improve things a bit more
I'm not even sure if generating the agenda using zulip integration is any better than just running the cli
my (possibly uninformed opinion) is that bot commands are useful when you need them often, other than that - not sure.
yeah, I'm not sure
I meant, they are always useful :)
the problem is that the cost of implementing things is not zero
so, I'm not just talking if it's a benefit to have those commands but also if it's a good use of the time
anyway, tomorrow I'm going to pay extra attention to this to see what should we do :)
is there something else to discuss?
I don't have anything else I guess
not sure if its the scope or the wg o not, bt since we track it it would be useful -
i was wondering if every time toolstate breaks, we could automatically open a thread in alerts
well it's great that you bring up toolstate breaks into the table :)
because it's something that I always have doubts about
like I don't see how pieces fit together
I'm not sure what value are we adding here
I mean, I'm more than happy to help whenever is possible but I have the feeling that we are not doing anything useful to be honest
who would be the right recipient for such notifications?
i agree
all we seem to be doing is checking a website, seeing that it fails and sending a message to somebody
to be honest, I'd prefer to avoid this kind of tasks because are very boring, gives the sense of doing something useless and may drive people away from the working group
that doesn't mean that we shouldn't do it :)
but if we were going to do something I'd prefer to take more responsibility and doing something that make us feel a bit proud than just notifying people :)
is there a reason compiler team tracks toolstate?
I've no idea
I think we shouldn't do that
it was originally part of the process and we just followed it
but it always giving me an unpleasant sensation to be really honest :slight_smile:
I would say - let's try ignoring it for a while. If no one complains ... well that wasnt so needed
and again, it's not because I don't want to do it, it's because I feel useless by doing that :)

apiraino said:

I would say - let's try ignoring it for a while. If no one complains ... well that wasnt so needed

I think we should coordinate this at a higher level
i'm not sure how the dev-tools or each of the corresponding teams conducts their affairs (like meetings), but if they do or can do so then it would be best if they keep tracking it
I meant, Rust as a project needs to track that and needs to fix breakages before releasing
maybe by coordinating at a higher level we can give this a bit more purpose

DPC said:

i'm not sure how the dev-tools or each of the corresponding teams conducts their affairs (like meetings), but if they do or can do so then it would be best if they keep tracking it

right, maybe that's the answer
I mean, could we track who the recipient for that tooling is and discuss what would be best to do ?
this is why I'm saying that this needs to be coordinated at a higher level :)
with other teams or with people like pnkfelix or nikomatsakis that are more project wide knowledgeable than I :)

[Quoting…]
not sure it's good idea to risk a broken toolstate :grinning: it will just push more work on to someone else
@DPC which message were you answering?

Santiago Pastorino said:

DPC which message were you answering?

probably my joke about ignoring the toolstate :)
probably it made sense earlier with clippy and the other tools just tagged along and were being tracked - but now since clippy no longer requires it - it does feel out of scope to track
err network issues so messages may have got manglde
anyway, we're over time
I'm going to reach out to nikomatsakis and/or pnkfelix about this
and get back to the group
that would be helpful :slight_smile:
thanks!
ok, I guess this is all
:wave: everyone!!!
